header.description:
Customer last logged-in time with the TSP application.
All dates in the HTTP headers are represented as RFC 7231 Full Dates. An example is below:
Sun, 10 Sep 2017 19:43:31 UTC
Customer IP address when making a request with the TSP application.
Unique correlation ID to playback response for each request.
Standard HTTP header to indicate the natural language set used in the response.

description.content: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

header.description: (Required) Standard HTTP header that allows credentials to be provided to the authorisation/resource server. Based on the OAuth 2.0/OIDC framework, this consists of basic or bearer authentication schemes.
(Required) Standard HTTP header indicating the format of the payload provided in the request. Content-type could be set to application/json.

Header indicating the time (in seconds) that the TSP could wait before retrying an operation. The bank could consider including this header along with responses with the HTTP status code of 429 (Too Many Requests).
